bayou.http

Class HttpRequestImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.http.HttpRequestImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HttpRequest

    public class HttpRequestImpl
extends Object
implements HttpRequest
    A mutable implementation of HttpRequest.

    An HttpRequestImpl can be modified after construction, e.g. by header(String, String). These mutation methods return `this` for method chaining.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpRequestImpl

        public HttpRequestImpl(String method,
                       String uri,
                       HttpEntity entity)
        Create an http request.

        See uri(String) for permissible `uri` arguments. It's preferred that `uri` is an absolute URI; otherwise, the caller should set the host afterwards.

        Examples: 

             new HttpRequestImpl("GET", "https://example.com/", null);

     new HttpRequestImpl("GET", "/search?q=cat", null).host("localhost:8080");

     new HttpRequestImpl("CONNECT", "proxy.com:8080", null);

     new HttpRequestImpl("OPTIONS", "*", null).host("example.com");

      • HttpRequestImpl

        public HttpRequestImpl(HttpRequest originRequest)
        Copy an http request.

        This can be used for request transformation, for example to change the URI, add a header, etc. The origin request is treated as read-only and will not be modified.

      • uriPath

        public String uriPath()
        Description copied from interface: HttpRequest
        The path component of the request URI.

        The path is the substring before the first question mark ("?"). For example, if uri()=="/query?term=cat", then uriPath()=="/query".

        Specified by:
        uriPath in interface HttpRequest

      • uriParam

        public String uriParam(String name)
        Description copied from interface: HttpRequest
        Get the value of a parameter in the request URI.

        For example, if uri()=="/query?term=cat", then uriParam("term")=="cat".

        The query component of the request URI is parsed as "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" with UTF-8 charset. If there's any parsing error, this method returns null.

        See FormParser for more options.

        Specified by:
        uriParam in interface HttpRequest

      • httpVersion

        public String httpVersion()
        Get the HTTP version.
        Specified by:
        httpVersion in interface HttpRequest

      • headers

        public HeaderMap headers()
        Get the headers.

        The returned map is mutable; the request producer can manipulate it at will. See also header(name,value).

        Specified by:
        headers in interface HttpRequest

      • cookies

        public Map<String,String> cookies()
        Get the request cookies.

        The cookies are parsed from the "Cookie" header; see parent javadoc.

        The returned Map is read-only. To modify cookies, see cookie(String, String) and cookies(java.util.Map) methods; or you can always set the "Cookie" header directly.

        Specified by:
        cookies in interface HttpRequest
        See Also:
        HttpRequest.cookie(String)

      • uri

        public HttpRequestImpl uri(String uri)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Set the request URI.

        The behavior of this method depends on the request method, which should be settled before calling this method.

        See HttpRequest.uri() for permissible `uri` arguments.

        In addition, this method also accepts absolute URI, which may change isHttps(boolean) and host(String) too.

        Examples: 

             req.uri( "/search?q=cat" );   // path-query
     req.uri( "proxy.com:8080" );  // CONNECT
     req.uri( "*" );               // OPTIONS

     req.uri( "https://example.com/" );  // absolute URI
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • header

        public HttpRequestImpl header(String name,
                              String value)
        Set a header.

        If value==null, the header will be removed.

        Returns:
        this

      • cookie

        public HttpRequestImpl cookie(String name,
                              String value)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Set a cookie.

        If value==null, the cookie will be removed.

        See Cookie for valid cookie name/value.

        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • cookies

        public HttpRequestImpl cookies(Map<String,String> cookies)
        Set the cookies.

        All existing cookies will be removed. This method sets a new "Cookie" header based on provided cookies.

        See Cookie for valid cookie name/value.

        Returns:
        this
